subtopics.name: Sorting Algorithms
subtopics.description: Covers basic sorting algorithms such as Bubble Sort, Selection Sort, and Insertion Sort, including their operational principles and applications.

subtopics.name: Searching Algorithms
subtopics.description: Explores searching techniques like Linear Search and Binary Search with their use cases and time complexity analysis.

subtopics.name: Graph Algorithms
subtopics.description: Involves complex algorithms such as Dijkstra's and A* for pathfinding and navigating graphs, including real-world applications in networking and AI.

subtopics.name: Arrays and Linked Lists
subtopics.description: Introduction to fundamental data structures including arrays and singly/doubly linked lists, their operations, advantages, and disadvantages.

subtopics.name: Stacks and Queues
subtopics.description: Study of stack and queue data structures, their implementations, and applications in programming.

subtopics.name: Trees and Graphs
subtopics.description: Explains binary trees, binary search trees, AVL trees, and graph theory fundamentals, including traversals and applications in databases.

subtopics.name: Object-Oriented Programming
subtopics.description: Covers core principles of OOP including classes, objects, inheritance, and polymorphism in programming contexts.

subtopics.name: Functional Programming
subtopics.description: Explores the fundamentals of functional programming paradigms, higher-order functions, and immutability considerations in software design.

subtopics.name: Concurrency in Programming
subtopics.description: Discusses the principles of concurrency, including threading, parallelism, and synchronization in various programming languages.

subtopics.name: Big O Notation
subtopics.description: An introduction to time and space complexity measuring techniques using Big O notation, focusing on basic comprehension.

subtopics.name: Comparative Analysis
subtopics.description: Investigates the efficiency of algorithms through comparative analysis and case studies in the context of performance implications.

subtopics.name: NP-Completeness
subtopics.description: An advanced examination of NP-complete problems, their characteristics, and implications on computational theory.

subtopics.name: Introduction to ML
subtopics.description: Covers fundamental concepts of machine learning including supervised and unsupervised learning, with practical applications in real-world scenarios.

subtopics.name: Feature Engineering
subtopics.description: Focuses on methods to process and extract meaningful data features suitable for machine learning models.

subtopics.name: Overfitting and Underfitting
subtopics.description: Discusses the concepts of model generalization, overfitting, and underfitting, including prevention techniques in training models.

subtopics.name: Firewalls and VPNs
subtopics.description: Introductory knowledge on firewalls and VPNs, their purposes, and basic configuration scenarios.

subtopics.name: Intrusion Detection Systems
subtopics.description: Understanding of various intrusion detection systems (IDS), their functioning and the methodologies behind them.

subtopics.name: Security Protocols
subtopics.description: In-depth analysis of security protocols such as SSL/TLS, their mechanisms, and applications in secure communications.

subtopics.name: Process Management
subtopics.description: Introduction to process lifecycle, scheduling algorithms, and multithreading concepts in operating systems.

subtopics.name: Memory Management
subtopics.description: Covers concepts of memory allocation, paging, segmentation, and garbage collection techniques.

subtopics.name: File Systems
subtopics.description: Explores advanced file system principles, including file organization, storage allocation, and filesystem types.

subtopics.name: SQL Basics
subtopics.description: Introductory tutorial on SQL queries, CRUD operations, and relational database fundamentals.

subtopics.name: Normalization
subtopics.description: Study of database normalization forms, their benefits, and the impact of normalization on database design.

subtopics.name: Transactions and ACID Properties
subtopics.description: Advanced exploration of database transactions, ACID properties, and their importance to data integrity and concurrency.
